title: The Papers: 'Pay up, PM' and 'Navy probes sex pest scandal'
description: The papers report a visit by Rishi Sunak to a Croydon hospital and claims about misconduct in the Navy.

title: Paul Pelosi attack: Violent extremism warning ahead of US election
description: Hours after Nancy Pelosi's husband is attacked, US intelligence warns candidates face a "heightened risk".

title: Trapped in Saudi Arabia: A mother's fight to free her daughter
description: Carly took her daughter to Saudi Arabia to visit her father. Three years later, she's still there.

title: Putin pins Ukraine hopes on winter and divisive US politics
description: As fears grow of Russian nuclear escalation over Ukraine, Steve Rosenberg explains why he considers such a drastic step unlikely.

title: Nancy Pelosi's husband Paul recovering after hammer attack surgery
description: The intruder allegedly demanded to see top US Democrat Nancy Pelosi, and left her husband with a fractured skull.

title: UK foreign aid being spent in Britain passes £4bn mark, experts say
description: The government spends more of the aid budget at home than on direct help overseas, estimates indicate.

title: Cost of living: Bridgend woman says kids worried they won't eat
description: One mother says a charity is supporting her as the rising costs of heating and food hit home.

title: The Highland haven insulated from rising energy prices
description: A hydroelectric scheme provides power for the 120 people living in the remote community of Knoydart.

title: Rail services disrupted by latest ScotRail 24-hour strike
description: More than 2,000 RMT workers are staging another 24-hour stoppage after rejecting the latest pay offer.

title: 'You think twice about driving': Fuel prices rise again
description: The rise in diesel and petrol prices is having a particularly tough impact in rural areas.

title: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Manchester United are finally coming back to form
description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says Manchester United are on their way back to being competitive at the top of the table.

title: Rugby League World Cup: New Zealand 48-10 Ireland highlights
description: Jordan Rapana, Peta Hiku and Jahrome Hughes score two tries each as New Zealand produce dominant victory over Ireland at Headingley to leave the Wolfhounds on the brink of a World Cup exit.

title: Gloucester 38-22 Exeter Chiefs: home side claim fourth consecutive Premiership win
description: Gloucester win their fourth Premiership match in a row as they beat Exeter 38-22 in front of a sold-out Kingsholm.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Crushing New Zealand win leaves Ireland facing exit
description: New Zealand cruise to a 48-10 victory to leave a forlorn Ireland facing a group-stage exit from the World Cup.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Further arrest in murder probe
description: A man is arrested on suspicion of assisting an offender over the murder of the nine-year-old.

title: Ebbw Vale: CCTV shows rogue driver wrecking police car
description: Dino Price admitted dangerous driving, affray and driving without a licence or insurance.

title: Mexican Grand Prix: Carlos Sainz fastest in first practice
description: Carlos Sainz leads Charles Leclerc in a Ferrari one-two in first practice at the Mexican Grand Prix as 0.2 seconds separated the top six drivers.

title: Attacked owl rescued by fishing crew 100 miles out to sea
description: The long-eared owl was rescued after being attacked by gulls off the north coast of Scotland.

title: Iran protests: Fresh clashes in Zahedan
description: Security forces reportedly fire on protesters in Zahedan, as anti-government unrest continues.

title: Suella Braverman in denial over forced resignation, sources say
description: The home secretary tried to claim her data breach was "a minor thing", according to sources.

title: Wasps: Club suspended from Premiership for rest of the season

description: The notorious wild man of rock’n’roll - who married his 13-year-old cousin and shot his bass player - has died at 87.

description: A court hears Mahek Bukhari denied any involvement in the death of her mother's former lover.

title: Gisele Bundchen and Tom Brady announce divorce
description: The pair confirm their separation and say they "arrived at this decision amicably".

title: Manchester United: Antony says he will not change his ways

title: UK and France vow to tackle migrant boats
description: Downing Street says the two leaders pledged to work on deterring "deadly journeys" in the Channel.

title: NI Assembly election to be called but no date set
description: NI Secretary Chris Heaton-Harris says he will give more more information next week.

title: Piet Mondrian artwork displayed upside down for 75 years
description: Despite the find Piet Mondrian's painting will continue to be shown as it is to avoid any damage.

title: Red Bull: F1 team receive $7m fine & 10% aero research reduction
description: Red Bull have been hit with a $7m (£6.07m) fine and a 10% reduction in permitted aerodynamic research for breaking Formula 1's budget cap.

title: The woman set alight by her ex who 'got on with life'

description: Lift Me Up is taken from the soundtrack of the forthcoming movie Black Panther: Wakanda Forever.

description: Jemma Mitchell killed her friend Mee Kuen Chong to try to inherit her estate for home renovations.
